properties.areaDesc: Eastern McDowell; Alexander; Greater Burke; Greater Caldwell
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 7 at 3:14AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
Moisture crossing western North Carolina this morning ahead of a
low pressure system and associated cold front will produce mainly
a cold rain across the North Carolina foothills. However, the
precipitation could start out as a mixture of snow, sleet, and
freezing rain in some locations around daybreak, and spotty ice
or snow accumulations will be possible through mid-morning. The
precipitation will end quickly later in the morning hours, with
temperatures rebounding into the 40s this afternoon.

Use caution if traveling across the northern foothills of western
North Carolina this morning. Spotty ice accumulations from
freezing rain or sleet could create slippery surfaces in areas
where the temperature briefly dips to 32 degrees.

NWSheadline: PATCHY SNOW...SLEET...AND FREEZING RAIN COULD AFFECT THE NORTHERN FOOTHILLS OF WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA THIS MORNING
